alert.note: Alert for Barnwell (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 11:38AM EDT until June 14 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Burke, Columbia and Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Edgefield, Lexington and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, North Augusta, Evans, Aiken Mall, Clearwater, Belvedere, Augusta, Martinez, Hephzibah, Williston, Blackville, New Ellenton, Jackson, Aiken State Park, Citizens Park, Barnwell State Park, USC Aiken, Gloverville and Graniteville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 22. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 196 and 201. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
